subject: Learning
title: The Second Language Window
description: A quick, practical guide to The Second Language Window.

hook.text: 'You must learn a language before puberty or you never will.' That claim needs serious nuance.

buildup.text: There is a sensitive period for acquiring native-like pronunciationâ€”roughly before age 12.

discovery.text: But grammar, vocabulary, and communication skills can be learned effectively at any age.

twist.text: Adult learners actually acquire vocabulary faster than children because they have better learning strategies.

climax.text: The accent might reveal a late start, but fluency doesn't require a childhood beginning.

punchline.text: Start any time. Perfect accent is optional. Communication isn't.

quiz.question: What is the sensitive period mainly relevant for in language learning?
